org.efaps.admin.ui

Class AbstractUserInterfaceObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.efaps.admin.AbstractAdminObject
      • org.efaps.admin.ui.AbstractUserInterfaceObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, CacheObjectInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractCollection, AbstractCommand, Field, Image

    public abstract class AbstractUserInterfaceObject
extends AbstractAdminObject
    This Class is the Abstract Class for all UserInterfaces in eFaps.
    In this Class only a few Methods are defined which are common to all Class inside the UserInterface Package. With this Class all UserInterfaceObjects can be initialized, the Access is checked and the Triggers for the UserInterfaceObjects are handled.
    Version:
    $Id: AbstractUserInterfaceObject.java 4820 2011-06-19 01:37:58Z jan.moxter $
    Author:
    The eFaps Team
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • readFromDB

        protected void readFromDB()
                   throws CacheReloadException
        The instance method reads all needed information for this user interface object. Here, only the properties are read from the database
        Throws:
        CacheReloadException - on error during reload
        See Also:
        AbstractAdminObject.readFromDB4Properties(), AbstractAdminObject.readFromDB4Links(), readFromDB4Access()

      • hasAccess

        public boolean hasAccess(AbstractUserInterfaceObject.TargetMode _targetMode,
                Instance _instance)
                  throws EFapsException
        Check, if the user of the context has access to this user interface object.
        The Check is made in the following order:
        1. If no access User or role is assigned to this user interface object, all user have access and the return is true => go on with Step 3
        2. else check if the context person is assigned to one of the user objects.
        3. if Step 1 or Step 2 have true and the context an Event of the Type TriggerEvent.ACCESSCHECK, the return of the trigger initiated program is returned
        Parameters:
        _targetMode - targetmode of the access
        _instance - the field will represent, e.g. on edit mode
        Returns:
        true if context user has access, otherwise false is returned
        Throws:
        EFapsException - on error

      • hasAccess

        public boolean hasAccess(AbstractUserInterfaceObject.TargetMode _targetMode,
                Instance _instance,
                AbstractCommand _callCmd,
                Instance _callInstance)
                  throws EFapsException
        Check, if the user of the context has access to this user interface object.
        The Check is made in the following order:
        1. If no access User or role is assigned to this user interface object, all user have access and the return is true => go on with Step 3
        2. else check if the context person is assigned to one of the user objects.
        3. if Step 1 or Step 2 have true and the context an Event of the Type TriggerEvent.ACCESSCHECK, the return of the trigger initiated program is returned
        Parameters:
        _targetMode - targetmode of the access
        _instance - the field will represent, e.g. on edit mode
        _callCmd - the cmd that called this UI-Object
        _callInstance - the instance the object is called in
        Returns:
        true if context user has access, otherwise false is returned
        Throws:
        EFapsException - on error
